name: Crayfish Lodge Sea & Country Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the views are simply beyond- this gorgeous modern home is directly on the rocks overlooking the sea. Our lovely host Sandra spent a lot of time making us feel welcome and recommending one of our best meals in South Africa at the charming Rosemary's just a few minutes away (like Grandma's quaint antiques-filed house but with WAY better food!). Sandra and Reinhard thought of everything when they built this house for guests, from the chic furnishings and very well-appointed bathrooms (ahhh the shower!), to their vast DVD collection, down to the heated floors that perfectly took the chill off our wintertime visit. Wish we had had more time to spend here- next time maybe we'll catch sight of the whales! Note: our rented Garmin GPS system for some reason directed us a block away, so do follow the posted signs (or enter "Cryfish" Lodge and then Garmin will direct you to the right place).
reviews.title: Stunning seaside experience

reviews.text: My wife, myself, and a friend spent two nights at the Crayfish lodge in late April and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a wonderful experience. Sandra and Reinhard were very welcoming, very informative, and gracious. Every recommendation was spot on - coastal flight with Evan, dinner, wineries, walking routes, and the local pub (like going back in time). Spring for the suite and you will not be disappointed - the sunsets were glorious!
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a trip around the Western Cape and stayed at Crayfishlodge for our last night.
reviews.title: PERFECT in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend it wholeheartedly! Reinhard and Sandra are the most wonderful hosts, making us feel special from the minute we arrived to the minute we left with just the right measure of attention and at the same time giving us space. It felt like home. In the Luxury Travel business attention to detail is extremely important. As a tour operator I enjoy visiting guesthouses and lodges to make sure I really know what I am recommending to travelers. Well, I sure found a gem!
reviews.title: WARM AND WELCOMING

reviews.text: Crayfishlodgge has exceeded our expectations in every way: Warm and friendly service, fantastic location overlooking the ocean and with direct access to a lovely walking trail along the coast and a little beach just below. there is a lot of stuff to do in the area, from Sharkcage diving to Whale Watching in season, Kajaking, coastal walks and beaches good for swimming nearby. There are several wineroutes nearby that can be visited, art and craft shops - and Sandra and Reinhard are always updated about the new and exciting things happening in the Gansbaai and Hermanus area, and eager to share their knowledge with their guests.
reviews.title: PERFECTION!!

reviews.text: Crayfish lodge is a modern, well equipped guest house in an excellent location with great views over the sea. We stayed for two nights on a family holiday and were slightly apprehensive as we don't normally stay in guest houses. However, we need not have feared. From the sight of its great architecture and interior fit out to the warm welcome from Sandra and her husband Reinhard we were immediately at ease. The bedrooms are comfortable and well equipped and the public rooms are airy and well designed with views over the coast. There is a private path down to the coast for those who want to walk along and watch whales from the coastal path. Although evening meals are not available we were offered the opportunity when booking to pre book dinners in the restaurant at the nearby Grootbos Nature Reserve. This is well worth taking advantage of for the excellent location, food and great value for money. Sandra's breakfasts were excellent with options that would suit everyone.
reviews.title: A very warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been staying at Crayfish Lodge for five days and we enjoyed every minute! It is a beautiful guesthouse next to the sea. There is a small footpath that takes you straight down to the water. Don’t miss the stunning hike along the coast!
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a very nice room with lovely sea view. Great breakfast! Don’t waste your time looking for other places – you can’t find a better one!
reviews.title: So memorable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only able to stay for 2 nights as they were fully booked, but we wanted to stay for more and we plan to return. Reinhard and Sandra are the most perfect hosts, nothing was too much trouble and Sandra gave us so much information. Breakfast was gorgeous, the room was marvellous, and the view was stunning. What more can one say?
reviews.title: A time to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I needed a special place to celebrate our 27th wedding anniversary . We had the privilege to spend a night at crayfish lodge. We will go back again anytime even just to say hallo to Sandra and Reinhard. We can recommend the Crayfish lodge for a lot of reasons but go and see the view from your bedroom balcony and you will agree with us
reviews.title: One of the best Guest House with fantastic hosts.

reviews.text: This is a fantastic place, right on the seashore, with a fantastic view of the ocean. We had a beautiful morning walk along the beach, leaving straight from our room, along the beaches, and saw whales in the distant. The day after we saw 4 whales playing in the bay, 5 min walking from the lodge. The inside is marvellously furbished, the breakfast is home made and great. The hosts, Sandra and Reinhard, are very warm and friendly, happy to help and give valuable advises (e.g. about where to eat and to whom to go out for a whale watching trip). This is a must place if you go to the area and want to see whales!
reviews.title: Fantastic place with stunning view over bay and whales!

reviews.text: We stayed at Crayfish in August 2012 for one night only - we found the place over the internet and did not know what to expect. The lodge is beautiful, with a great communal space with a double height glass wall overlooking the most amazing sea view. We also discovered that the place is actually better than Hermanous for whale watching. Directions to a nearby hike took us on one of our best walks while in South Africa.
reviews.title: Great place and great support!

reviews.text: Breakfast was a feast of home made cooking. What made our stay very special though is that our 18 old daughter unexpectedly had to deal promptly with a number of admin tasks relating to her university accommodation. Our hosts, SAndra and Rehinard went totally out of their way when we drove back to the lodge (after having already left for Cape Town), and ended up spending the morning there using their computers, fax machines and telephones to sort her out. Not only that, when we called back from Cape Town they booked for us the most amazing "sea safari", with a reputable, environmentally conscious company, again going out of their way to provide us with directions when we got lost on our way to the boat. Our only regret is that we stayed only one night, we will definitely go back!
reviews.title: Perfect again
Staying at Crayfish Lodge, spectacular
reviews.text: We stayed last week with friends at Crayfish Lodge. It was wonderful, as always. Warm rooms, very comfortable beds, good shower. Just perfect. We saw the whales jumping while lying on our bed. Very nice breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a warm welcome we received by owners and hosts Sandra and Reinhard in beautifull Crayfish lodge. Our room was really very luxerious and nice and warm, because of the cold weather this was appriciated very much aswell. Comfortable beds and stunning views over the bay made the stay complete. In de morning wales could be seen from our own room and from the wide balcony at the grand lounge.
reviews.title: Simply Spectacular

reviews.text: This was a secret tip by a friend and I am so glad we went there. We had a wonderful time at the Crayfish Lodge. The service was amazing and the hosts ever so friendly and welcoming. We had a great room with a view. I could have spent the whole day there just looking out onto the ocean. We even had breafkast watching the whales as they were playing just by the bay. A wonderful place. I can only recommend it and hope to go back there very soon.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to South Africa a number of times and always been surprised by the quality of the properties that we have stayed in, Crayfish Lodge is up there with the very best. We booked a panorama suite not cheap but fantastic value for money, the bathroom was stunning and the views amazing. De Kelders is a little off the beaten path but in my opinion offers the best whale watching in South Africa, with sightings even this late in the season. The hospitality is wonderful, as are the breakfasts. One word of warning though. the daily aqua gym is not for beginners. just ask Thomas from Zurich.
reviews.title: Crayfish Lodge a little slice of heaven.

reviews.text: A fab view! Even before you can properly greet the owners, you cannot help but look out over the sea and the wonderful view. Charming owners too. They cannot do too much for the guests. Comfortable bedrooms and while the suites up top are much more expensive, my friends who opted for one of those rooms, couldn't run out barefoot in the morning and down the grass to the little beach! So each has its pluses and minuses. Breakfast was delightfully different: home cooked goodies that broke the mould of South African breakfasts and lots of choices. Good coffee and teas, and the wine in the evening was also delicious. It is a lovely place, and I hope to return. It is not cheap - by local standards and certainly not by European standards - but sometimes you have to treat yourself!
reviews.title: Luxury with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Crayfish Lodge for two nights. We were in the beautiful top floor suite with a private balcony and wonderful view of the sea and it was magnificent. The owners were charming and very hospitable and the breakfast was as good as described by other reviewers.
reviews.title: Beautiful Home away from home

reviews.text: I would recommend the place without hesitation (and the dinner at Grootbos which was amazing !).
reviews.title: I Hope I Can Return!

description: Elegant modern true sea front guest house with superb sea views. 2 Panorama Suites, 3 stylish Atlantic Garden Rooms, all sea facing. Here you will enjoy some of the finest sea views in South Africa.
